Room.Name: A Fog-Shrouded Trail
Room.Description: You are on a fog-shrouded trail which runs up the side of this dark mountain. The ground is wet and muddy with melted snow, and the path which should lead to the Miden'nir disappears amongst the mist and the trees. There is nothing for you to do but follow the trail that twists up towards the broken, snow-covered heights of the mountain range. An old stone tablet with inscriptions stands beside a bush in the corner.

Exit.Description: The Haunted Pine Forest lies above.

ExtraDescription.Description: You may obtain a free copy of Emerald Forest from any of the authors below. No part of this area may be modified or transmitted, in any form known to mankind without the formal consent of the author(s). You may however modify it so as to render it compatible with the running of your mud. Modified to Never NeverLands By Rhax the Chaotic Spirit of Rangers

Room.Name: The Haunted Pine Forest
Room.Description: The snow begins to fall thickly as you enter a pine forest in the mountains. The burnt remains of two log cabins lie in a clearing about a dozen yards off the path. There is a disconcerting silence in these woods, an oppressive lifelessness that makes you want to leave them immediately. The trail stretches through these haunted woods up the side of the mountain and down through the fog to the foothills of the range.

Exit.Description: Move further up and you'll be near the summit.
You see a fog shrouded trail.

Room.Name: Near the Summit
Room.Description: It has become almost unbearably cold as you trek near the very summit of the mountain. The bare and broken trees provide no cover for you as a cold and gusty wind whips the falling snow harshly into your face. A pine forest covers the slopes of the mountain, while to your south you spot a narrow mountain pass.

Exit.Description: The Haunted Pine forest is below.

Room.Name: A Mountain Pass
Room.Description: You are in a steep pass between mountain peaks. It descends sharply to the south, while heading north towards a summit. All around you, you see only the mountain rises and the wind-swept plateaus of these ancient highlands.

Exit.Description: You see the summit of the mountain.

Room.Name: A Mountain Pass
Room.Description: The mountains part breath-takingly to reveal a huge forest of tall and majestic oaks. You can walk along a mountain creek which winds west, down the side of the mountain and into the forest, or follow the trail you are on and continue up the mountain pass.

Room.Name: A Thickly-Wooded Dell
Room.Description: You are in a secluded dell at the foot of a great mountain range. Old valley ash are crowned with the slightest hint of frost, and bushes of flowering foxglove line the bank of a stream which runs west into a small vale. To the south there is a great forest of majestic oaks, while to your east a trail that seems little-used heads into the mountains.

Exit.Description: You can make out a Signpost of sort in that direction.
The road to Clover lies to the west.

Room.Name: A Signpost in the Enchanted Forests
Room.Description: Through the majestic oaks of these ancient woods, the deep earthiness of the forest permeates your senses, while a gentle hum of magic in the air pulses low and vibrant. A shy nymph peeks inquisitively at you from behind a tree before disappearing with a titter. An old but sturdy signpost stands beside a crossing in the paths, which lead in every direction.

Exit.Description: A well-used trail through the forest lies to the east.

ExtraDescription.Description: The sign seems to provide directions etched in a spidery hand. North to the Vale of Clover South into the Emerald Forest East to the Rangers' Lodge West to the Witch Wood where evil lurks

Room.Name: A Fae Crossing
Room.Description: The path has taken you to a junction over which hangs the twisted branches of two Blackthorn trees and an Elderwood tree. You remember folktales which tell that spiteful faeries lurk under the meetings of such trees to waylay and confound woodland travellers. Feeling a little uncomfortable, you look south, where the forest seems to darken menacingly. The east trail beckons you to the safety of the Emerald Forest.

Exit.Description: You can make out a Signpost of sort in that direction.

Room.Name: Road to the Vale of Clover
Room.Description: You are on an old road which runs alongside a clear stream. It leads to the Vale of Clover, a small valley at the foot of the mountains. Looking down the road, you see a small village nestled beside a bend in the stream. Tall heather blows in the wind and you see some cows grazing idly nearby. The road east runs down into a wooded dell.

Exit.Description: You see a thickly wooded Dell.

Room.Name: In Clover
Room.Description: It's quite beautiful here in the quiet village of Clover. The air is fresh and filled with the scent of flowers. There are some quaintly- appointed cottages painted in bright colors on either side of the road. You hear ringing laughter to the east, where a country path winds up a hillock. The village square lies to the north.

Exit.Description: The Green Hillock is to the East.
The road leading out of Clover is there.

Room.Name: A Green Hillock
Room.Description: You are on a small meadow on the hillock. This seems to be where the folk of Clover have their picnics. From the sound of manly crooning accompanied by girlish titters, you deduce it also where the local lasses receive the attentions of their suitors. Scattered trees and trimmed hedges provide the green with shadynooks and pivate arbors. The hillock continues north, while the path west will take you back to the village.

Exit.Description: The road to Clover is to the West.

Room.Name: A Secluded Corner of the Meadow
Room.Description: You are in a quiet corner of the meadow, well-shaded by two large cypress trees. Though empty now, it seems a likely spot for young couples to exchange professions of love, undisturbed by friends or irate parents. Having no time for such adolescent frivolities, you quickly scan the countryside and note that from this vantage point, you can look over the entire village of Clover. You espy a dirt track which leads west from the village and then turns north to a ruined abbey.

Exit.Description: The Green Hillock is to the South.

Room.Name: The Village Square
Room.Description: A couple of farmers are erecting a "Harvest Moon Festival" sign over where you are standing. A gaggle of goodwives are gossiping by the village well while their children are chasing a playful dog. An apple tree lends its shade to two old men who are sharing a large tankard of cider. You see a large farm to the north and a beaten dirt track to the west.

Exit.Description: You see a path leading out of the villlage.
You see an old dirt track.

Room.Name: An Old Dirt Track
Room.Description: You are on an old dirt track outside the village of Clover. The path seems little travelled, and wildflowers grow abundantly by the side of the track. Heading east, you will return to the village. The dirt track continues north for some miles.

Exit.Description: The old dirt track continues north.
The village square is to the east.

Room.Name: An Old Dirt Track
Room.Description: Looking north, you see a ruined monastery at the end of the track, half- hidden by a copse of cypress trees.

Exit.Description: You see a huge monastary ahead.
The old dirt track continues south.

Room.Name: Farmer Griff' Farm
Room.Description: You stand in front of a gaily-painted barnhouse. Old Griff - farmer, freeman and entrepreneur - seems to be having a little trouble keeping his livestock in order. His chickens are harrying his ducks in the duck pond, while a big brown shaggy dog is chasing his pigs around the entire farm. From inside a blue and yellow farmhouse you hear Princess Yaruga, the farmer's wife, shouting angrily in a foreign tongue.

Exit.Description: The village square is to the south.

ExtraDescription.Description: Buy <item> - Buy an Item. Sell <item> - I don't want your stuff dude! Value <item> - I ain't an educated chap pal! **** I Don't Give CREDIT ****

Room.Name: The Witch Wood
Room.Description: You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters. Ghost lights flicker palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting plants and animals that cover the forest floor. The twisted thorn trees groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems to taunt you from the cover of darkness. The forest stretches on for miles.

Exit.Description: You see the entrance of witch wood to the south.

Room.Name: The Witch Wood
Room.Description: You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters. Ghost lights flicker palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting plants and animals that cover the forest floor. The twisted thorn trees groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems to taunt you from the cover of darkness. The forest stretches on for miles.

Room.Name: The Altar of Sacrifice
Room.Description: The trees seem to hang back in fear as you walk into a wide clearing in the witch wood. The clearing is dominated by a broken stone altar that is caked red and black and the blood and grime of centuries of evil. The torches that hang from the boles of the trees ringing the clearing throw a halflight on a deep hole in the altar.

Room.Name: The Witch Wood
Room.Description: You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters. Ghost lights flicker palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting plants and animals that cover the forest floor. The twisted thorn trees groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems to taunt you from the cover of darkness. The forest stretches on for miles.

Room.Name: The Witch Wood
Room.Description: You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters. Ghost lights flicker palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting plants and animals that cover the forest floor. The twisted thorn trees groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems to taunt you from the cover of darkness. The forest stretches on for miles.

Room.Name: The Witch Wood
Room.Description: You are deep in the Witch Wood. The evil that taints these woods grows palpable here. Directly to your north is a wall of shifting shadows that your light cannot penetrate. Tall reeds with thorny blades grow around a path that leads west into the mists. The forest lies to your east and south.

Exit.Description: You see a broken jetty ahead.

Room.Name: The Wall of Shadows
Room.Description: You step into shadows and suddenly hellish voices shriek into your ears. Your light flares brightly for an instant and you see the trees around you writhing while they burn in black flames. They bend their branches into a series of glyphs and runes, forming an archway across the entrance of a cavern to the east. The voices stop suddenly, and you are once again all alone in the darkness.

Exit.Description: You make out 3 figures in the darkness ahead.

Room.Name: The Cavern of the Witch Sisters
Room.Description: This is the abode of the Witch Sisters. Gibbets hang from the ceiling, scrying pools lie placid while cauldrons gurgle awfully. From a large rift in the ground infernal flames belch forth. The heat in the cavern is almost unbearable and you begin to feel yourself passing out from the oppressive stench of brimstone.

ExtraDescription.Description: A low voice from the dark beckons you gravely into the flames. You feel compelled to plunge deep into the fiery chasm.

Room.Name: The Witch Wood
Room.Description: You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters. Ghost lights flicker palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting plants and animals that cover the forest floor. The twisted thorn trees groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems to taunt you from the cover of darkness. The forest stretches on for miles.

Room.Name: The Witch Wood
Room.Description: You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters. Ghost lights flicker palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting plants and animals that cover the forest floor. The twisted thorn trees groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems to taunt you from the cover of darkness. The forest stretches on for miles.

Room.Name: The Witch Wood
Room.Description: You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters. Ghost lights flicker palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting plants and animals that cover the forest floor. The twisted thorn trees groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems to taunt you from the cover of darkness. The forest stretches on for miles.

Room.Name: The Witch Wood
Room.Description: You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters. Ghost lights flicker palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting plants and animals that cover the forest floor. The twisted thorn trees groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems to taunt you from the cover of darkness. To the south a fog rolls out onto a dead marsh.

Exit.Description: You see the entrance of witch wood to the east.

Room.Name: The Entrance of the Witch Wood
Room.Description: Your uneasiness mounts as you walk along this haunted stretch of road. The mist clears, and you find yourself in a nightmarish forest. The empty husk of a dead nymph lies at your feet, and on either side of you, the trees look twisted and tortured into unnatural shapes. The depths of the forest sends up a hopeless cry to usher you into the woods that ring the edge of Hell.

Room.Name: Under Dark Woods
Room.Description: The path continues darkly under rows of Elder trees. A crooked road leads west through a tangled hedge of briars. A mist prevents you from looking beyond the hedge, but you sense a powerful and oppressive evil reaching out towards you with cold and clawed fingers. To the south, the forest seems to lighten considerably, and you are about to leave in that direction when a tattered parchment, flapping weakly in the wind, falls at your feet.

Exit.Description: A crossing of sorts lies to the north.
You see the entrance of witch wood to the west.

ExtraDescription.Description: (Parchment: It is yellowed and seems savagely ripped from a tome. "... I mouthed a prayer for my fallen brother Alandro as I raised his morning-star to smite the foul witch who had struck him down. But I had reckoned without her Sisters, and the twain now flew shrieking towards me. The first, diabolically transformed, pinioned me to the ground, while her corrupt breath drove the sight from my eyes and caused boils to burst from my skin. The other, whom I had seen to be beautiful but terrible even as I was made blind, wrested my weapon from me and tore at my face. I know not how I fled from their cursed abode, but the relief I felt then at my escape was vainly felt, for even now, I nightly suffer the torments of their evil blandishments. In my sleep I see myself being chased at the edge of a black abyss by the Devil's huntsmen and their hellhounds slavering for my soul. I wake up drained, I feel both my faith and my sanity slipping from me. We had been foolishly proud, thinking we could destroy those servants of evil alone. Now we are undone, and the relic of our Holy Saint is lost forever." )

Room.Name: The Emerald Forest
Room.Description: All the lingering beauty of these green woods conspire to charm you into staying here forever. Woodlarks are singing high in the boughs of trees while shafts of sunlight turn the forest floor into a carpet of gold and green. The woodland trails running through this area of the forest seem well-kept, yet untravelled.

Room.Name: The Emerald Forest
Room.Description: All the lingering beauty of these green woods conspire to charm you into staying here forever. Woodlarks are singing high in the boughs of trees while shafts of sunlight turn the forest floor into a carpet of gold and green. The woodland trails running through this area of the forest seem well-kept, yet untravelled.

Exit.Description: A well-used trail through the forest lies to there.

Room.Name: A Well-Used Trail Through The Forest
Room.Description: You are on a forest trail that runs in all directions but north, where the forest skirts the sheer mountain face. Dew-covered hawthorn bushes flank the east trail, along which several rangers are walking. It seems to be the woodkeepers' outpost.

Exit.Description: The Woodkeepers' Outpost is to the east.

Room.Name: The Woodkeepers' Outpost
Room.Description: Your fellow rangers hail you as you stride into this wide clearing. Some are preparing to leave on their daily treks through the forest, while others are tending to injured woodland animals. The Guildmaster's cabin lies to the north, while several smaller cabins lie to the south. A fair-sized lodge sits beneath a Redwood tree to your east.

Exit.Description: The Guildmaster's cabin lies to the north.
Smokey's Supplies is to the east.
A wood-keeper's cabin is to the south.
A well-used trail through the forest lies there.

Room.Name: The Guildmaster's Cabin
Room.Description: Built from the logs of sturdy cypress trees from the Vale of Clover, the Guildmaster's cabin has a homely feel to it. Oaks have grown their low branches across the roof of the cabin and any number of small forest animals race along the length of the porch. Elesar of the Woods is here, instructing a young woodkeeper.

Exit.Description: The Wood-Keepers' Outpost is to the south.

Room.Name: Smokey's Supplies
Room.Description: You enter a lodge which sits under the shade of an ancient Redwood tree. All manner of supplies and equipment useful to rangers and woodkeepers are neatly stacked on shelves or stored in closets. A parchment tacked on a wall lists the supplies which you may purchase from Smokey, the Ranger Bear who runs the supply store.

Exit.Description: The Wood-Keepers' Outpost is to the west.

ExtraDescription.Description: Buy - Buy an Item. *brrrrrrr* Sell - Smokey needs nothing from ya! Value - *Brrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr* *** NO HAGGLING ALLOWED ***

Room.Name: The Emerald Forest
Room.Description: All the lingering beauty of these green woods conspire to charm you into staying here forever. Woodlarks are singing high in the boughs of trees while shafts of sunlight turn the forest floor into a carpet of gold and green. The woodland trails running through this area of the forest seem well-kept, yet untravelled.

Room.Name: In the Emerald Forest
Room.Description: A circle of blue-capped mushrooms form an old faerie ring by the side of the path you are on. On certain nights of the year, the faerie folk wander out into such rings for wild dances by the moonlight. It is said that mortals who are drawn into the dancing circle on such nights can be held captive by faerie food or a faerie's kiss and made to dance on and on for a period of seven years. You hear a titter of laughter from the branches of a tree, but when you look up you see nothing.

Exit.Description: A great tree lies to the east.

Room.Name: Before the Great Tree
Room.Description: You stand at the perimeter of the largest, most incredible tree that you have ever laid eyes on. It has gold-flecked leaves that are the size of small horses, with thick roots supporting a massive trunk that is easily twice the size of the grand fortress of the Templar Knights of Renhorden. It seems to stretch endlessly into the sky, and you wonder why you did not see it towering above all the other trees in the forest. You long to inch closer, but cannot seem to move beyond an invisible barrier that keeps you about a hundred yards away. You see movement and lights in and about the tree, but there seems to be no way you can get closer to it.

Exit.Description: A faerie hill lies to the south.

Room.Name: The Lost Grotto
Room.Description: You follow the stream to a limpid pool where the waters lap gently against the rocks. Large ferns provide shade from above and the petals of brightly-colored flowers float in the pool. Sitting on the moss- covered rocks by the pool is a slim young girl dressed in green. She has long black hair and elfin features, a yew bow slung across her back. She seems oblivious to your presence and hums softly as she passes her hand through the waters.

Exit.Description: A stream flows to the south.

Room.Name: By a Stream
Room.Description: You stand by a wide stream that flows swiftly to the north. Drawn by the sudden sound of musical laughter, you look over the tops of some lilac bushes and spy a group of nymphs frolicking in the stream. It seems like a vision captured from some nature god's idyllic dream. You hear the distant roar of a waterfall to your south.

Exit.Description: A pool forms to the north.
A waterfall glade lies to the south.
A faerie hill lies to the west.

Room.Name: The Waterfall Glade
Room.Description: A majestic waterfall pours from high above the mountains to the south. Great torrents of water crash down on the rocks in a wide pool, and even where you stand in a shaded glade, the wind blows sprays of water into your face. A profusion of flowering shrubs grow at the edge of the pool. In a large shaded retreat made by the overhanging branches of silver oak trees stands a likeness of Altariel, the Lady of the Woods. At the base of the waterfall, a rock pool with crystal clear water has formed.

Exit.Description: A stream flows to the north.

Room.Name: In the Emerald Forest
Room.Description: The path here runs around a low grassy mound. Looking closer, you see the smallest of windows built into the mound. It appears this is a faerie hill, from which the faerie Rades ride out in celebration through the wood paths of the Emerald Forest. The angry face of a faerie suddenly stares out at you from the window and interrupts your scrutiny with a string of curses.

Exit.Description: You see a great tree there.
A stream flows to the east.
You see a three-way junction to the west.

Room.Name: In the Emerald Forest
Room.Description: You are at a three-way junction in the middle of the woods. Wild trumpet creepers run along the footpaths here. It would seem some mischievous pixie has drawn the vines across the path with the hope of tripping woodland travellers such as you. You watch your step.

Exit.Description: A faerie hill lies to the east.

Room.Name: The Emerald Forest
Room.Description: All the lingering beauty of these green woods conspire to charm you into staying here forever. Woodlarks are singing high in the boughs of trees while shafts of sunlight turn the forest floor into a carpet of gold and green. The woodland trails running through this area of the forest seem well-kept, yet untravelled.

Exit.Description: You see a three-way junction to the east.

Room.Name: The Only Stump in the Forest
Room.Description: In this small lonely clearing is an ancient stump. Many years ago, a forester callously hewed down a tree here. In retribution, Altariel, whose sanctuary the Emerald Forest is, transformed him into a poplar tree. The poplar tree stands here beside the stump, its branches cut by the rangers of the forest whenever they are in need of wood.

Room.Name: The Emerald Forest
Room.Description: All the lingering beauty of these green woods conspire to charm you into staying here forever. Woodlarks are singing high in the boughs of trees while shafts of sunlight turn the forest floor into a carpet of gold and green. The woodland trails running through this area of the forest seem well-kept, yet untravelled.

Room.Name: The Forest Road
Room.Description: You are at the head of a long north-south road in the forest. The Greenbrier bushes that grow beside the path have shed their heart-shaped leaves on the road. All is quiet here. To the north, dark Elder trees loom out ominously. The road continues south.

Room.Name: The Dead Moors
Room.Description: Everything is black here. These bleak moorlands are where the witches plant the bodies of their victims, where the rotted corpses will rise by moonlight as souless pumpkin men. The fetid marsh pools have been the graves of countless creatures, and the choking stench of death rises from them.

Room.Name: The Dead Moors
Room.Description: Everything is black here. These bleak moorlands are where the witches plant the bodies of their victims, where the rotted corpses will rise by moonlight as soulless pumpkin men. The fetid marsh pools have been the graves of countless creatures, and the choking stench of death rises from them.

Exit.Description: You see a hill in the marsh.

Room.Name: The Dead Moors
Room.Description: Everything is black here. These bleak moorlands are where the witches plant the bodies of their victims, where the rotted corpses will rise by moonlight as soulless pumpkin men. The fetid marsh pools have been the graves of countless creatures, and the choking stench of death rises from them.

Room.Name: The Dead Moors
Room.Description: Everything is black here. These bleak moorlands are where the witches plant the bodies of their victims, where the rotted corpses will rise by moonlight as soulless pumpkin men. The fetid marsh pools have been the graves of countless creatures, and the choking stench of death rises from them.

Exit.Description: You see a hill in the marsh.

Room.Name: A Hill in the Marsh
Room.Description: You have come upon a low hill in the marsh. As you ascend it, you notice that the fog that covers the rest of the fens rolls away. The weeds are dry at the edge of the mound and the grass that grows here is is lush and green. A lone oak tree stands on the mound, like a beacon of goodness that repels the evil of the witches.

Room.Name: The Forest Road
Room.Description: You are walking a long a north-south road in the forest. The Greenbrier bushes that grow beside the path have shed many heart-shaped leaves on the road. Two blue-breasted swallows swoop low in front of you, trilling out a morning song. The road continues north and south.

Exit.Description: A trail lies to the south.

Room.Name: The Forest Road
Room.Description: You are walking a long a north-south road in the forest. The Greenbrier bushes that grow beside the path have shed many heart-shaped leaves on the road. Two blue-breasted swallows swoop low in front of you, trilling out a morning song. The road continues north and south.

Room.Name: A Trail
Room.Description: Pausing a moment from your travels through the Emerald forest, you hear the gurgling sound of moving water coming from the east, while to the south the forest continues on with oak, pine and rosewood. Peering intently toward the source of the sound, you notice a faint outline of a bridge resting in the shade of the long leafy branches of the tall, flanking trees.

Exit.Description: A woodland trail lies to the south.

Room.Name: A Shady Bridge
Room.Description: You stand on the western end of a wooden bridge in the Emerald Forest. It's origin is a mystery, but the fine detail and craftsmanship it bears would rival even the most cunning of woodsmiths. The branches of the tall trees that grow on the banks of the stream cover the bridge in a soft cool embrace while a breeze flows in from the north. Huge salmon and rainbow trout weave their way amongst the rocks in the stream below. To the west the forest stretches on, while the sounds of laughter and play drift in softly from the south.

Room.Name: The Shady bridge
Room.Description: You stand on the eastern end of a finely crafted wooden bridge. It's edges have small engraved runes carved into them, and the wood is probably a form of pine or oak from the Emerald Forest itself. Lacking the dull weathered tone and creaking of most wooden bridges, it spans across a fairly wide river flowing in a north-south direction. The height of the surrounding trees provide a pleasant shade from the noon-day sun.

Room.Name: A Woodland Trail
Room.Description: You are following a small woodland trail in the Emerald Forest. The hear the sound of moving water to the west, and squinting a bit intently you see a blurred outline of a small wooden bridge in the distance. Who built that bridge? And why? Only a few seasoned rangers have ever come this deep into the enchanted wood, and none ever mentioned the existence of construction of a bridge. As far as you know, the forest has resisted gently but firmly all attempts at colonisation or lumbering, which makes it quite a curiousity.

Exit.Description: A dense path lies to the east.
A shady bridge lies to the west.

Room.Name: A Dense Path
Room.Description: You are walking deep in the Emerald Forest. The protective canopy of the tall rosewood trees offer a welcomed protection against the sun's rays as well as providing a home for thousands of living things, some of whom chirp, sing or buzz their existence for all to know, while others remain silent, at least to your ears while the aroma of fresh woodland flowers fill the air.

Exit.Description: A clearing opens to the south.
You see a woodland trail there.

Room.Name: A Woodland Trail
Room.Description: You are following a small woodland trail in the Emerald Forest. Off in the distance to the east, you hear the sound of a roaring waterfall. The trail continues to the north and south.

Exit.Description: A faerie hill lies to the north.
A dense path is to the south.

Room.Name: In the Emerald Forest
Room.Description: You are walking deep in the Emerald Forest. The tall oak trees all around you offer welcome shade and provide homes for innumerable woodland creatures. You spot a brown squirrel darting away from the bole of a tree in an industrious search for more nuts and berries. The paths lead north, south and west.

Exit.Description: A three-way junction lies to the north.
A woodland trail is to the south.

Room.Name: The Emerald Forest Choir
Room.Description: Pushing aside a tangle of falling vines, you find yourself on a trail deep in an unexplored area of the Emerald Forest. Passage to the north and south are blocked by clustered thickets of sagebrush and rosemary. The cheerful croaking of a tree-frog catches your eat, accompanied by the soprano trill of a swallow and an acapella team of bush insects. The trail allows travel to the east and west.

Exit.Description: A woody copse is to the west.

Room.Name: A Woody Copse
Room.Description: You've stumbled into a small woody copse. The trees here have grown close and their curtains of vines obscure the view in any direction. The fresh scent of wild thicket flowers hang in the air, the source of which cannot be found. A small green carpet lies in the middle of a clearing, leading you to believe you've happened across someone's quiet time area.

Room.Name: The Tree House
Room.Description: This is a small platform with four walls and a leaf roof rather than a proper tree house. Nevertheless, it is very cosy and could accomodate two quite comfortably. A pot of jasmine tea is simmering over a fire and a few plush cushions are scattered on a rug in one corner. On a shelf on the west wall are the complete works of Shakespeare, while another book lies half-read on the floor.

Room.Name: A Small Clearing
Room.Description: You stand in a small clearing deep in the Emerald Forest. The ground shows no evidence of trees being cut down or any other indication that the clearing is carved from axe or hand, yet the borders seem too neat to be the result of Mother Nature's whim. In some areas the shrubs and bushes appear to have gone out of their way (if that is possible) to align themselves, and the soft wood grass while not having the blunt heads of a kept garden seem to be growing neatly in line all by themselves. Strong magic is at work here.

Room.Name: The Ragged Trail
Room.Description: You stand on a ragged forest trail with passage leading in all four directions. The pathways to the north, south and east lead deeper into the woods, while a winding trail west seems to end in a small clearing. From where you stand you can see small movement and curious sound which you can't quite make out. The tree branches sway softly while you decide your next course.

Exit.Description: You see the south-easterly end of the forest.
You see a bunch of pixies and brownies in a game.

Room.Name: The Honey Bun
Room.Description: Two lines of pixies and brownies stand facing one another yelling and hooting in excitement. They seem to be deep in a game of 'Pixie, Brownie and Honey Bun'. A small bag filled with pipeweed seed is placed squarely in the middle of the line, while both teams are numbered off. A number is called, and the respective brownie or pixie has to run forward, grab the bag and return to the line without being touched. Looks like great fun.

Exit.Description: A ragged trail lies to the east.
The south-east end of the Bonanza is there.
You see a fairly large clearing to the west.

Room.Name: A fairly large clearing
Room.Description: There is an incredible sight before you! Dozens and dozens of green clad pixies and oak brown dressed brownies are milling around in a fairly large clearing, which stretches on to the east and south. Little temporary stalls have been set up, selling a wide variety of enchanting desserts, cream puffs and wonderful potions. The grand Pixie-Brownie Bonanza Festival seems up in force, and there are no signs of it ending in the near future...

Exit.Description: You see a bunch of pixies and brownies in a game.
The south-west end of the pixie bonanza is there.
You see a three way woodland ahead.

Room.Name: The three way woodland
Room.Description: You stand at the middling spot of a three way woodland trail deep in the Emerald Forest. There are clear passages to the north, west and east, while the path to the south abruptly ends at the foot of a sheer cliff face, with a wall so smooth that it would be impossible to climb. A variety of bird song and animal sound fill the air.

Exit.Description: You see a fairly large clearing to the east.
A forest trail lies to the west.

Room.Name: A Forest Trail
Room.Description: The somewhat ragged west-ward forest trail makes a sharp right and southernly turn here, making further travel to the west difficult if not impossible, would be safer to backtrack and find another path instead of hacking through the notoriously resilient trees of the Emerald Forest. A tall tree with huge leafy branches branches stands here tempting you to take a break and rest in it's shade.

Exit.Description: You see a three way woodland to the east.

Room.Name: A Dwindling Forest Path
Room.Description: The forest path begins to dwindle here. It's obvious you've entered a part of the forest seldom visited by anyone. You notice the richness of the flora here, with a wider and thicker range of herbs growing in wild abandon across the ground or in small cul-de-sacs formed at the roots of the oak trees. You hear a rustle in the bushes, but staring intently without trying to look too obvious, you notice nothing.

Exit.Description: You see a small tombstone to the south.

Room.Name: A Lovely Trail
Room.Description: You are following a faint north-south trail in the Emerald Forest. Swallows and Bluebirds fill the air with song and laughter, and you spy a small red-breast Robin sitting motionless on a branch on one of the oak trees. The serenity of this forest is amazing, you feel at peace and safe, as though you just stepped into a fairy tale where the knights kill all the trolls, and nobody stays hungry. It's hard not to day dream, walking here.

Exit.Description: A Forest trail lies to the north.
A forest path lies to the west.

Room.Name: The Tombstone
Room.Description: There is something rather peculiar about this part of the Emerald Forest. A small tombstone sits in the middle of a small clearing. Carved from a white substance, it's shiny surface reflects what little sunlight that manages to escape from the umbrella covering of trees surrounding the grave. Freshly picked flowers lie at the foot of the tombstone, while strange symbols are lovingly engraved on it. The strange thing is there are no paths leading from or to the area, which would puzzle even the most observant elf or ranger. Who would pick flowers for a lone grave and leave no evidence of passing?

ExtraDescription.Description: Etched on the well-dusted tombstone are the following words... In loving memory of my beloved Bella.. DD.

Room.Name: The Wood-Path
Room.Description: The Wood-path you're following gets more pronounced and used here, a testimony that the Emerald Forest isn't populated (or at least explored and travelled) only by it's original furry or buzzing citizens. Multi-coloured flowers dance gaily in the wind while clinging to the feet of the tall oak and pine trees flanking the forest road. Flying squirrels leap from branch to branch, probably searching for a delicious cashew or two.

Room.Name: Woodkeeper's Clearing
Room.Description: The path ends in a medium sized clearing. A small wooden sign states quite dogmatically "WoodKeeper's Clearing. Forest haters not welcomed. Orcs, Bugbears and Goblins keep out!" . A number of elves and humans dressed in a mixture of green and brown stand around here engaging in friendly conversation. The actual Keeper's Meet hasn't started yet, apparently there are rangers from distant woodlands still trying to make it for the meeting. A pile of scrolls sit on a small table, probably pamphlets to be distributed to the arriving participants of the meeting.

Exit.Description: Some green vines lies to the east.

Room.Name: The Green Vines
Room.Description: Thick green vines form an impossible barrier to the south. There is no reason to doubt that these vines possess the same ability to block even the most determined machete-armed lumber-dwarf then all the others. What does seem a bit strange, however, are faint footsteps leading up to the vines and abruptly stopping. Could they merely be tracks from an age past, now lost to the world and found only in time and memory?

Exit.Description: You see a grove in the forest.
The border of the forest lies east.

Room.Name: The Silent Grove
Room.Description: You've managed to wander into a small silent grove in the forest. For some strange reason most of the forest noises seem to have disappeared, though you can feel the rustle of the leaves beneath your feet as you walk. The silence isn't really eerie, however, but more of a contemplative quietness. Small stones are arranged in an odd fashion on the ground, much the way seating chairs would be arranged should the speaker be in the middle of a circle. It's almost as though a little tribe of beavers just had a river-dam guild meeting and have left for lunch.

Exit.Description: You see thick green vines in the yonder.

Room.Name: The Southern border
Room.Description: You are skirting the southern border of the Emerald Forest. A sheer mountain face blocks any further exploring to the south and east, while the forest streches on to the north and to the west. A fallen log lies here, softing morning due and rain spray clinging to it's sparkling bark. No rotting scent seems to come from it as most logs would emit.

Exit.Description: You see thick green vines in the yonder.

Room.Name: The Wood Area
Room.Description: The trail leading south from here starts sloping downward into a richer wood area. The undisturbed nature of the flora suggests that this is a rarely travelled part of the forest even by it's own standards. A small mouse-deer runs across the trail, followed by a lazy looking lynx. To the north you can just make out a clearing through the trees, and there seems to be movement.

Exit.Description: A clearing is to the east.
You see the southern border of the forest.

Room.Name: The Bonanza
Room.Description: Standing here at the south-west end of the Brownie-Pixie Bonanza Festival, your senses are quickly overloaded with sight, sound and smell. Brownies clad in soft brown cloth with little feathered hats mingle happily with their slightly smaller and greener cousins, the forest pixies. An almost musical chitter-chatter fills the air, while the aroma of freshly baked treats drift in from the north. There seems to be a forest dweller's competition, what with the many games the pixies and brownies seem to be playing. A tug of war is currently in progress, with the heaving Brownies having a slight lead over the grunting Pixies.

Exit.Description: You see a fairly large clearing.
The south-east end of the Bonanza is there.

ExtraDescription.Description: Buy - Buy an Item. Order your flowers fast!

Room.Name: In a Myrtle Shade
Room.Description: You are in a clearing ringed by mulberry bushes. You hear racuous shouts of festivity coming from the north where the Brownie-Pixie Bonanza is in full swing. In the centre of the clearing is an old Myrtle tree, under the shade of which some revellers have taken to rest. A lone thrush sighs from a branch of the tree. To the west a trail slopes gently down.

Exit.Description: The south-east end of the Bonanza is there.

Room.Name: The Bonanza
Room.Description: You are standing at the south-east end of the Brownie-Pixie Bonanza Festival. A major element of the celebration involves the grand feasting of the Great Pie of Friendship. A great huge pumpkin pie the size of farmer's cart stands proudly on a stone table with a white tablecloth amidst a bodyguard regiment of apples, peaches, raspberries and cookies. The dozens of eager eaters seem a bit impatient, apparently this year's Bonanza Chairman (or Grand Pooh-ba) hasn't opened the ceremony yet.

Exit.Description: You see a bunch of pixies and brownies in a game of Honey Bun.
You see the South-easterly end of the forest.
A clearing is to the south.
The south-west end of the Bonanza is there.

Room.Name: South-easterly end of the forest
Room.Description: You stand at the southern most end of the Emerald Forest. The path continues on north, while to the west appears to be a large clearing with sounds of laughter and conversation drifting in with the breeze. There is a sheer drop to the south, while moutains stretch on as far as your eyes can see. The terrain belows seems mostly rock and stone and has spare vegetation. You can just make out a small path heading roughly to the east through a cluster of bushes and trees.

Room.Name: Within a garden
Room.Description: You've managed to stumble into an oriental home. A small wooden hut sits to the south of a garden lovingly nurtured with blooming yellow, white and red flower blossoms. Two stone lions sit on wooden pillars guarding entrance to the garden, while two jade dragons guard the door to the hut proper. A small bucket pulled well stands next to a pen of chickens and ducks who cluck and quack away merrily. Carrots, cabbages and rice are grown in a medium sized plot of land to the north. There is a small rock pool to the east.

Exit.Description: You see the southern end of the forest.

Room.Name: A peaceful rock pool
Room.Description: You've entered a very peaceful part of the mystic's home. A crystal clear pool sits here with large smooth pebbles neatly arranged all around it's circumference. Peering into the pool, the unmoving mirror like surface of the water reflect your image. There is no way of knowing exactly how deep the pool is, but it must be very deep since you can't see the bottom. There is a small wooden bench here beckoning you to sit and rest for a while, and ponder things you've put aside, and think on matters you've forgotten.

Room.Name: Yun Fei Yang's humble abode
Room.Description: You stand in the living room of a small wooden hut. A small partioned kitchen is to the south of here. The spartan furniture, tidiness and simple basic furniture hint at the occupier's character. There is a beautiful painting of a young oriental women dressed in long flowing silk on one of the walls. Parchments with foreign exotic wordings in flowing black ink script sit on a desk. A small book catches your eye, it's title being "Zhuge Liang's Chinese-Orthosi Dictionary". Some of the scrolls here are written in a language you can understand.

ExtraDescription.Description: As you flip open the dictionary, it falls open to a well-read page... Tian -> Heavenly sky Can -> Mystical web Shen -> Special Gong -> Force Ni -> You Wo -> Me Gan -> Dare Dou -> Fight Kan -> See Si -> Die Gou -> Dog Yan Se -> Colour Qi Dao -> Pray Jiu Ming -> Help! Pang Pai -> Cabal Jing Cha -> Justice Ruan Dang -> Entropy Tan Dang -> Shadow Shen Shi -> Master Zhan Shi -> Battle Yong Shi -> Knight Shen Xian -> Immortal Fa Lao Sao -> Whining -*-

Room.Name: The Ruined Monastery
Room.Description: Tangled vines of ivy hang down from what remains of the arch-entranced of this small monastery. It is ruined beyond repair and seems to have been abandoned many years ago. There is a quiet and melancholic silence in the air. You notice footprints in the dust that lead west into a leaf-strewn courtyard and continue into a small chapel. You notice for the first time that that area of the monastery seems to have been spared the dereliction that the rest of the monastery has fallen into.

Exit.Description: The old dirt track continues south.

Room.Name: The Chapel of Saint Sebastian
Room.Description: You stand within the only standing structure of the once proud Monastery. Evidently the chapel is looked after for the floors are swept, pews wiped and the stained-glass windows in good working order. A modest pulpit made of mahogany with a carved pine cross attached to it faces a few rows of wooden benches. Probably cared for by questing paladins or clerics on a pilgrimage, you wonder if any of the faithful might be nearby. To the west wall you see a hole large enough for you to squeeze through.

Exit.Description: You see a huge monastary there.
You see a knight in the distance.

Room.Name: Outside the Wall of the Monastery
Room.Description: You stand in a small clearing outside the west wall of a small chapel within a monastery. Birdsong fills the air while butterflies yellow and red flutter about happily. A tall large oak brings shade further west, but all movement to the north and south is prevented by a combination of trees and the old stone walls of the monastery. There is a serenity and a sense of life and peace, hinting that it is often used by others as a place of worship or contemplation.

Exit.Description: You see a chapel in the distance.

Room.Name: The Dead Moors
Room.Description: Everything is black here. These bleak moorlands are where the witches plant the bodies of their victims, where the rotted corpses will rise by moonlight as soulless pumpkin men. The fetid marsh pools have been the graves of countless creatures, and the choking stench of death rises from them.

Room.Name: The Dead Moors
Room.Description: Everything is black here. The fogs rolls into the edge of the woods to the north, while in every other direction the desolate marshes darken your spirits. Small creatures are feeding on each other at your feet, while others are clawing their way to the surface of the mud. A sudden wind blows the fog away, and you see a small lake through the tall reeds to the west.

Room.Name: The Dead Moors
Room.Description: Everything is black here. The fog rolls into the edge of the woods to the north, while in every other direction the desolate marshes darken your spirits. Small creatures are feeding on each other at your feet, while others are clawing their way to the surface of the mud.

Room.Name: The Witch Wood
Room.Description: You are in the eerie domain of the Weird Sisters. Ghost lights flicker palely about your feet and cast a shadowed eye on a variety of rotting plants and animals that cover the forest floor. The twisted thorn trees groan at your approach, and you are aware of a slow hissing that seems to taunt you from the cover of darkness. To the south a fog rolls out onto a dead marsh.

Room.Name: A Broken Jetty
Room.Description: You are at the head of a broken jetty, feeling the rotted timbers give way beneath your feet. The end of the jetty, which has long since collapsed, stands over a dark still lake. You look over the deep black waters and see lights on the shore of an island hidden in the mists.

Room.Name: A Woodkeeper's Cabin
Room.Description: You walk into the first cabin you see. It is simply but comfortably furnished. There are four beds in the cabin, where the woodkeepers of the Forest may rest after their patrols. There is a small chest by the foot of the bed.

Exit.Description: The Wood-Keepers' Outpost is to the north.

Room.Name: Inside the mountain
Room.Description: You walk into a large enclosure with gracious bison carvings and imported Swiss furniture. Cracked Egyptian pots with large flowering ferns sit on rainbow coloured sheepskin rugs. On the east wall, there is a charcoal sketched portrait of a party of raiding ragers standing over a field of multilated bodies of mages and clerics. Someone with bad taste obviously lives here.

Exit.Description: You see a huge boulder there.

Room.Name: Inside a Cottage
Room.Description: You are inside a neat and spotlessly clean cottage. The sanded wood plank floors and timbered walls gleam in the soft light of several small oil lamps, polished and waxed. Small ornaments of various shapes and sizes hang on the walls and bright tapestries drape the rough wooden furniture and curtained glass windows. Odd pieces of silver and crystal are sitting upon a long trestled table in the middle of the room. Flowers from the forest, all cut and arranged blossom from various vases and clay pots. The whole cottage looks bright and cheerful even with nightfall. Obviously, someone with good tastes lives here!

Room.Name: Iuppiter's Bedroom
Room.Description: You walk into a much smaller room filled with sculptures instead of small ornaments: over a hundred of them, lining the walls in holographic niches as well as scattered around the floor on ornate pedestals. The variety, as you have come to expect, is astonishing, ranging from human-style chunks of simple stone and wood to others that were more like tethered living creatures than works of art. Each is illuminated by a flaming blood candle, giving a sharp contrast to the darkness around. You can barely make out a huge bed that lies in the northeast corner of this gloomy room. Several other portals seem to lead out of this room. You wonder where they may lead to...

Exit.Description: A door blocks the Arena of Judgement.
You see a portal leading to Midgaard!
You see a lovely living room.

NPC.name: Dryad
NPC.description: With her slim fingers she holds her tree protectively as she looks at you, her brown eyes full of innocence and curiosity. As you approach her she looks startled and disappears into the tree, only to appear on the other side of it moments later to smile at you shyly. The dryad is just slightly taller than 5 feet and has the eternally beautiful and youthful features of the faerie folk.
NPC.longDescription: A dryad peers at you inquisitively from behind her tree.

NPC.name: Nymph
NPC.description: Her long hair is wet, as if just splashed with the waters of a crystal brook or stream. Her movements are full of grace and wild abandon as she dances along the forest path. You hear laughter like the sound of running water and you cannot be sure if it is her singing or a brook in the distance. She calls out to you to join her in her dance.
NPC.longDescription: A nymph looks coyly at you, then winks mischeviously and dances away.

NPC.name: Pixie
NPC.description: A small, knee high little pixie looks really engrossed with the activities of the Pixie-Brownie Bonanza. Not believed to exist by most of the normal folk of Orthos, he is clad in soft green leathers and cloth and wears a small cap with a proud rooster feather sticking out. Not looking at them directly, he seems to be eyeing one of the brownies.
NPC.longDescription: A small pixie stands here laughing cheerfully.

NPC.name: Sprite
NPC.description: The sprite darts about the trees nimbly. He is the brownie's cousin, and equally playful. He is dressed in a brown jerkin and you see that its pockets are filled with acorns and nuts.
NPC.longDescription: There is a sprite here about to pelt you with an acorn.

NPC.name: Brownie
NPC.description: This brownie seems totally oblivious to your presence, and she seems quite happy to continue chatting merrily to her friends. Slightly shorter than pixies, the brownies have a reputation of wit and cheeriness with a touch of mischief. Like most brownies, she has pretty elvin features, and is dressed totally in brown. She wears no cap, her otherwise long hair tied in a pony-tail.
NPC.longDescription: There is a cheerful brownie here chatting merrily away.

NPC.name: Ranger
NPC.description: A young man dressed in superb leather armour and green stands here, longbow strapped comfortably over his back and a longsword by his side. He has dark black hair, and has features which are both kind and handsome while lacking in weakness. He notices you and smiles, while continues tending to a small deer which seems to have injured it's leg.
NPC.longDescription: A ranger stands here, inspecting the ground.

NPC.name: Spriggan Iachimo
NPC.description: Iachimo is a spiteful prankster who often annoys the residents of the Emerald Forest. He sets fires at the roots of trees, poisons the streams and bites the pixies and brownies. He doesn't have a good bone in his spindly body and the forest would be well rid of him. He unleashes a torrent of curses at you.
NPC.longDescription: Iachimo the Dour Spriggan hides behind a tree grinning maliciously.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Scavenger Wimpy Thief AreaAttack AssistVnum

NPC.name: Gremlin
NPC.description: This is a disgusting little gremlin, with long crooked ears, a slimy green sticky body and a grin so wide you feel like tossing a few stones into it. It hops around making irritating noises, and looks like it would like to do you some harm and is thinking of it to. It's got 'kill me now' written all over it's forehead in every possible language known.
NPC.longDescription: A disgusting little gremlin grins at you.

NPC.name: Fiendish Donkey
NPC.description: The fiendish donkey looks sallow-skinned and mean-spirited. Most of them eventually end up roasted, toasted or flambed on some demon lord's banquet table. This one looks set to give you a good kick if you won't let it continue eating its weeds. It bares large yellowed teeth at you.
NPC.longDescription: There is a fiendish donkey munching on marshweeds here.

NPC.name: Devil's Huntsman
NPC.description: The Devil's Huntsman serves the witches and their master. He wears a rotting cape about his body and draws his weapon slowly. He has been preparing for the Great Hunt and in a low voice he intones your name.
NPC.longDescription: The Devil's Huntsman looms out of the mists.

NPC.name: Pumpkin man
NPC.description: A gangling creature, made of sticks, bones, rags, dead weeds and a large squashed pumpkin has some how been animated by evil sorcery. It holds its boney hands out-stretched and seems to be asking you for a dance. A tango perhaps, or a foxtrot.
NPC.longDescription: A pumpkin man crawls out of a slime pool and dances towards you.

NPC.name: Ranger Guildmaster Elesar
NPC.description: This ranger outpost, hidden within the Emerald Forest is a loosely kept secret among rangers. Few folk with want to traverse the magical wood in search of it save the wood-keepers themselves. This ranger, an old friend of the forest serves as the guildmaster. Dressed in forest brown leathers and green cloak, he is currently practicing the use of his staff.
NPC.longDescription: The ranger guildmaster stands here, practicing with his staff.

NPC.name: Ranger Lord
NPC.description: A tall middle-aged man wearing a combination of light mithril chain and leather armour sits in a chair here. His jet black hair, piercing eyes and muscled arms are a testimony to his fighting prowess and physical fitness. He is intently carving some wooden sticks, probably arrows after he's finished with them.
NPC.longDescription: A silver haired ranger sits here making arrows.

NPC.name: Ranger Bear
NPC.description: Smokey smiles affably at you as he beckons you over to buy his wares.
NPC.longDescription: A twelve foot bear stands here scratching his crotch.

NPC.name: Grand Pooh-Ba
NPC.description: The Pixie-Brownie Bonanza is usually hosted and chaired by at least one individual formally known as "The Chairman of the Great Feast and Festival" but is usually referred to as the 'Grand Pooh-Ba' by most of the participants. This particular Pooh-Ba seems to have a bit of halfling blood in him, for he towers almost a head over the pixies and brownies. He is dressed in large and flowing green-brown robe, and seems rather busy with his duties.
NPC.longDescription: The Grand Pooh-Ba stands here in coloured robes looking busy.

NPC.name: Witch Aude
NPC.description: Her shimmering long hair, the colour of corn-silk shimmers as it catches the sparks from the fire. Aude looks at you with moistened lips and half closed eyes issuing an invitation you somehow cannot resist.
NPC.longDescription: Aude the witch is murmering soft curses to herself.

NPC.name: Witch Gertrude
NPC.description: This battered old soul has wandered far and long from her coven Dulritch. The years have not been good to her, her eyes filled with weary hatred, her mottled cheeks and her gnarled skin testify to her long suffering and an intense adhorrence for all beauty and youth.
NPC.longDescription: Gertrude stands here giving you a killing gaze.

NPC.name: Witch Hela
NPC.description: Hela, the witch-goddess of the Nether realms has left her reign to join Gertrude. Born in a half-living, half-dead state, she harnesses the power of the undeed to destroy you!
NPC.longDescription: Hela is here hissing and snarling at you.

NPC.name: Jim Young
NPC.description: This young boy is Jim Surehand, son of Harry Surehand, the village blacksmith. Most people call him Young Jim, a nicknamed befitting his looks and his age. Holding a four leaf clover in his hand, he stares into space, not with insanity of philosophical thought, but the wishful malady that the young are known to fall into once in a while. Love.
NPC.longDescription: Young Jim sits here with a four leaf clover looking wistful.

NPC.name: Farmer
NPC.description: One of the inhabitants of the small vale village, this man looks quite content with his lot in life, for he's found the golden secret to happiness.. Work. Most of the men folk of the village are either farmers with a few hunters and trappers. His sun burnt arms and face mark him as a happy worker, and no slacker.
NPC.longDescription: A happy farmer is whistling happily away.

NPC.name: HotBlood bully
NPC.description: This young straw-chewing punk spits and clenches his fist at you. Better SCRAM! He looks around for Maddie, the local beauty.
NPC.longDescription: A rusty-haired village bully swaggers around threatening everyone in sight.

NPC.name: Maddie Beauty
NPC.description: Maddie looks at you with desperate eyes imploring your assistance against her ruffian suitors.
NPC.longDescription: Maddie is here running away from the village bullies.

NPC.name: Sheeka shopkeeper
NPC.description: Sheeka the pixie is one of the rare few of his hidden folk who have taken a somwhat business approach to life. He stands behind a small table with vases and jars and bottles filled with flowers blooming and spreading their wonderful scent everywhere. He wears a small green apron which reads "Roses for the loving, Lilies for the sad, Tulips for the laughing, violets for the glad".
NPC.longDescription: Sheeka Trilquill the pixie flower keeper is selling his wares.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Gain Changer Shopkeeper

NPC.name: goodwife wife
NPC.description: This plump woman looks like a typical wife of a farmer of peasant, and doesn't seem to be the selfish or suspicious sort but the friendly, "Come in and have some cookies" sort. Probably due to the fact that the vale village doesn't have many strangers and so they are largely spared the tricksters or thieves of the larger towns. Her basket is full of delicious looking apples and pears.
NPC.longDescription: A village goodwife stands here holding a basket of fruit.

NPC.name: Idiot
NPC.description: This poor unfortunate fool has been left to wander around the village. His brains are addled and he seems quite oblivious to your presence. He is singing a song over and over again and you catch its words... "As I wander'd the forest The green leaves among I heard a wild flower Singing a song: I slept in the earth In the silent night I murmur'd my fears And I felt delight. In the morning I went As rosy as morn To seek for new Joy But I met with scorn"
NPC.longDescription: The village idiot is here singing to the wind.

NPC.name: Knight Crusader
NPC.description: This Holy Knight looks battle weary and tired, and seems intent on praying. He is dressed in the battle mail of the Crusader knights, which looks somewhat battered but in otherwise good kept condition. Endless killing and bloodshed must be taking it's toil on this brave warrior monk, and he must be trying to regain spiritual peace and conscience with the Most High.
NPC.longDescription: A battle-worn looking knight sits here in quiet contemplation.

NPC.name: Sylph
NPC.description: Her fairy wings lie in tatters and her wrists have been bled. This mountain nymph was captured by the witches' servants and is chained here waiting to be sacrificed. You see that she has been whipped savagely and drained to a mere husk of her former self. If there is mercy to be found in this evil place, she will fade away before the witches come to sacrifice her tonight. She looks at you pleadingly.
NPC.longDescription: A poor sylph crying in pain is shackled to the Altar.

NPC.name: Irin girl elfin maid elf-maid
NPC.description: Irin is humming softly to herself. She is dressed in a forest-green tunic and soft leather pants, a yew bow slung across her back. She seems lost in her own world, her long black hair framing a face that is almost too beautiful to describe.
NPC.longDescription: A strikingly beautiful girl sits here alone on the rocks.

NPC.name: cat
NPC.description: This large lazy tabby opens one sleepy eye at you and then turns away as it you aren't there at all. It yawns delicately and swishes its tail from side to side. A sudden crackle of orange electricity runs down the length of its body and disappears.
NPC.longDescription: A large marmalade cat purrs contentedly atop a large book.

NPC.name: Kortho Wordgiver
NPC.description: Kortho is a paunchy dwarf dressed in a frown-gray robe. He spends his entire life giving out a word to everyone he meets. Unfortuantely he seems abit tight-lipped at the moment. You're probably going to have to beat it out of him.
NPC.longDescription: Kortho the Wordgiver is here. Is he going to give you... A word ?

NPC.name: Knight Sorrow
NPC.description: Before you is the famed knight of the Order of the Bleeding Hearts, Sir Sorrow. Famed fighters and honourable men, they have one nagging trait.. All of them seem full of sorrow and sadness all year round. It's not the sort of whining self-flagellation type insecurity or self-pity, but a strange and deep "sorrow" which they all seem burdened with. The Sorrow of God, perhaps? Nobody really knows save the members of the order.
NPC.longDescription: Sir Sorrow the sad knight stares into the sky.

NPC.name: priest YunFeiYang
NPC.description: As you approach the sullen bearded priest in close scrutiny, you can't help but feel a glow of mystical energy that permeates around his body. As if sensing your presence, he breaks out of his trance and begin faint chants of "Tian Can Shen Gong, Cheng Ba Wu Lin, Tian Xia Wu Di"... You draw back in ponder of this pointed-beard priest while his greyish- black apparel gives hint of his oriental origin.
NPC.longDescription: A tanned, white-haired priest sits cross-legged here, in deep meditation.

NPC.name: Farmer Griff man
NPC.description: Farmer Griff smiles and says "You musn't leave without trying my 'Char Siew Bao' ".
NPC.longDescription: A scrawny old man dressed in bermudas and an apron over his "Griff Can Cook" t-shirt stands here.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Gain Changer AssistAlign Shopkeeper

NPC.name: HellHound dog
NPC.description: The hellhound is a monstrous black dog with feral eyes and a sharply fanged maw. It snarls viciously and circles you slowly, seeming to consider you with an evil intelligence.
NPC.longDescription: A hellhound prowls here, slavering for your soul.

NPC.name: boogum
NPC.description: You seem to have interrupted the boogum's meal and he is not pleased. He looks like a dirty-furred dwarf with overly long hands and a mouth filled with sharp little teeth.
NPC.longDescription: The mountain boogum jumps out and gets set to bite you.

NPC.name: apparition priest
NPC.description: This must be the ghost of Brother Alandro, the priest of Saint Sebastian's abbey who succumbed to his vanity and challenged the witches. His strength proved less than his faith in himself and his spectre now wanders the edge of this dark lake forever.
NPC.longDescription: A gaunt apparition in priests' robes turns sadly towards the lake.

NPC.name: Demon-Elf girl
NPC.description: She is a lithe creature with impish features, dressed in flamoyantly colored rags. Her braided hair seems a mass of green serpents, but perhaps it's simply its wildness turning in the wind. She looks at you sharply and for a moment, you see upon her face the image of smiling demon.
NPC.longDescription: Cutting runes into the bark of a tree is a wild-looking elfin girl.

NPC.name: imbessar king
NPC.description: Imbessar is a brutish giant of man. Years ago he stole the Dead Star Circlet from the temple of Yog-Sothoth at Nag'Yrn, and has since crossed three worlds fleeing the vengeance of the dead god's acolytes. Weary of the endless flight, he has chosen to make his last stand here in the sanctuary of the Emerald Forest. As he whips about to face you, you see that ages of paranoia and fear have moulded a defiant snarl permanently on his scarred face.
NPC.longDescription: Imbessar the Bandit King prepares for his last duel.

NPC.name: Marisa enchantress
NPC.description: Marisa of Nag'Yrn is the chosen of Yog-Sothoth. She wears a samite gown of the purest white, her long flame-red hair tied up in an elaborate top-knot. A wretched look of cruelty crosses her young face as she contemplates the death of her nemesis, the Bandit King Imbessar. She has tracked him to the Emerald Forest and it is here that they will have their last battle.
NPC.longDescription: The Enchantress of Yrn seeks out her ancient nemesis.

NPC.name: Ranger
NPC.description: This woman seems (quite impossibly) to be having a conversation with the animals of the forest! Two blue jays, a squirrel and two rabbits are chittering and chattering and her smiles, laughter and responding noises suggest that it is a merry conversation. Possibly elven or half-elven, she looks about the age of a young human maid of twenty years, her long blond hair fall gently over her shoulders making her strikingly beautiful.
NPC.longDescription: A beautiful lady is talking to some animals here.

NPC.name: Pixie
NPC.description: A small, knee high little pixie looks really engrossed with the activities of the Pixie-Brownie Bonanza. Not believed to exist by most of the normal folk of Orthos, he is clad in soft green leathers and cloth and wears a small cap with a proud rooster feather sticking out. Not looking at them directly, he seems to be eyeing one of the brownies.
NPC.longDescription: A small pixie stands here laughing cheerfully.

NPC.name: Pixie
NPC.description: A small, knee high little pixie looks really engrossed with the activities of the Pixie-Brownie Bonanza. Not believed to exist by most of the normal folk of Orthos, he is clad in soft green leathers and cloth and wears a small cap with a proud rooster feather sticking out. Not looking at them directly, he seems to be eyeing one of the brownies.
NPC.longDescription: A small pixie stands here laughing cheerfully.

Not believed to exist by most of the normal folk of Orthos, he is clad in soft green leathers and cloth and wears a small cap with a proud rooster feather sticking out. Not looking at them directly, he seems to be eyeing one of the brownies.
NPC.longDescription: A small pixie stands here laughing cheerfully.

NPC.name: Brownie
NPC.description: This brownie seems totally oblivious to your presence, and she seems quite happy to continue chatting merrily to her friends. Slightly shorter than pixies, the brownies have a reputation of wit and cheeriness with a touch of mischief. Like most brownies, she has pretty elvin features, and is dressed totally in brown. She wears no cap, her otherwise long hair tied in a pony-tail.
NPC.longDescription: There is a cheerful brownie here chatting merrily away.

NPC.name: Brownie

NPC.name: Sprite
NPC.description: The sprite darts about the trees nimbly. He is the brownie's cousin, and equally playful. He is dressed in a brown jerkin and you see that its pockets are filled with acorns and nuts.
NPC.longDescription: There is a sprite here about to pelt you with an acorn.

NPC.name: Sprite

NPC.longDescription: There is a sprite here about to pelt you with an acorn.

NPC.name: Dryad
NPC.description: With her slim fingers she holds her tree protectively as she looks at you, her brown eyes full of innocence and curiosity. As you approach her she looks startled and disappears into the tree, only to appear on the other side of it moments later to smile at you shyly. The dryad is just slightly taller than 5 feet and has the eternally beautiful and youthful features of the faerie folk.
NPC.longDescription: A dryad peers at you inquisitively from behind her tree.

NPC.name: Dryad

NPC.name: Nymph
NPC.description: Her long hair is wet, as if just splashed with the waters of a crystal brook or stream. Her movements are full of grace and wild abandon as she dances along the forest path. You hear laughter like the sound of running water and you cannot be sure if it is her singing or a brook in the distance. She calls out to you to join her in her dance.
NPC.longDescription: A nymph looks coyly at you, then winks mischeviously and dances away.

NPC.name: Ranger
NPC.description: A young man dressed in superb leather armour and green stands here, longbow strapped comfortably over his back and a longsword by his side. He has dark black hair, and has features which are both kind and handsome while lacking in weakness. He notices you and smiles, while continues tending to a small deer which seems to have injured it's leg.
NPC.longDescription: A ranger stands here, inspecting the ground.

NPC.longDescription: A ranger stands here, inspecting the ground.

NPC.name: Gremlin
NPC.description: This is a disgusting little gremlin, with long crooked ears, a slimy green sticky body and a grin so wide you feel like tossing a few stones into it. It hops around making irritating noises, and looks like it would like to do you some harm and is thinking of it to. It's got 'kill me now' written all over it's forehead in every possible language known.
NPC.longDescription: A disgusting little gremlin grins at you.

NPC.name: Gremlin

NPC.name: Pumpkin man
NPC.description: A gangling creature, made of sticks, bones, rags, dead weeds and a large squashed pumpkin has some how been animated by evil sorcery. It holds its boney hands out-stretched and seems to be asking you for a dance. A tango perhaps, or a foxtrot.
NPC.longDescription: A pumpkin man crawls out of a slime pool and dances towards you.

NPC.longDescription: A pumpkin man crawls out of a slime pool and dances towards you.

NPC.name: Fiendish Donkey
NPC.description: The fiendish donkey looks sallow-skinned and mean-spirited. Most of them eventually end up roasted, toasted or flambed on some demon lord's banquet table. This one looks set to give you a good kick if you won't let it continue eating its weeds. It bares large yellowed teeth at you.
NPC.longDescription: There is a fiendish donkey munching on marshweeds here.

NPC.longDescription: A hellhound prowls here, slavering for your soul.

NPC.name: Devil's Huntsman
NPC.description: The Devil's Huntsman serves the witches and their master. He wears a rotting cape about his body and draws his weapon slowly. He has been preparing for the Great Hunt and in a low voice he intones your name.
NPC.longDescription: The Devil's Huntsman looms out of the mists.

NPC.name: Devil's Huntsman

NPC.name: Nymph
NPC.description: The fair-haired nymph spots you and smiles invitingly. A hint of mischief sparkles in her bright eyes. Her supple body glistens with splashes of water as her laughter rings gaily through the forest. A tunic wrapped loosely in a braided cloak of forest green lies among the lilac bushes.
NPC.longDescription: There is a nymph here frolicking in the stream.

NPC.name: Ranger
NPC.description: A young man dressed in superb leather armour and green stands here, longbow strapped comfortably over his back and a longsword by his side. He has dark black hair, and has features which are both kind and handsome while lacking in weakness. He notices you and smiles, while continues tending to a small deer which seems to have injured it's leg.
NPC.longDescription: A ranger stands here, inspecting the ground.

NPC.description: A young man dressed in superb leather armour and green stands here, longbow strapped comfortably over his back and a longsword by his side.
