He has dark black hair, and has features which are both kind and handsome while lacking in weakness. He notices you and smiles, while continues tending to a small deer which seems to have injured it's leg.
NPC.longDescription: A ranger stands here, inspecting the ground.

NPC.name: Devil Lieutenant
NPC.description: The Devil Lieutenant is a tall black-robed figure with piercing eyes and hooked claws at his fingers and toes. His scarred bestial face split wide at the snout to reveal a yellowish mass of crocked teeth. Once a resident in the sixth plane of Hell, he now watches over witchwood with his liege of huntsmen in service to Gertrude.
NPC.longDescription: The Devil Lieutenant sounds a carrion call and unleashes his magic upon you!

Item.Name: Stetson helm
Item.LongDescription: A large brown hat is trying to camoflage itself on the floor.

ExtraDescription.Description: The ancient Ranger Lord's Stetson is a wide-brimmed affair with a living oak leaf tacked to its front. It seems several sizes too large for you.

Item.Name: VainGlory Morning-Star Morningstar
Item.LongDescription: A large and ancient morning-star glows brightly on the floor.

ExtraDescription.Description: Along the oaken haft of this holy weapon is engraved a faded psalm: " .... Wilt thou hide thyself forever? Shall thy wrath burn like fire?"

Item.Name: Relic ikon
Item.ShortDescription: a Graven Ikon of Saint Sebastian
Item.LongDescription: Small and scarred, the wooden image of a Saint is resting here.

ExtraDescription.Description: Staring at the beatific face of this martyr Saint, you feel a sense of peace come over you. Although only a foot high, this sacred relic radiates an overwhelming aura of purity and holiness.

Item.Name: Rose black flower
Item.LongDescription: A black long stemmed rose with single thorn lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A vicious yet riveting black rose is here with a heady and sensious fragrance that assualts, yet compels your senses.

Item.Name: lily flower
Item.LongDescription: A white lily is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A spray of white bell-light flowers peeps shyly out at you from the delicate leaves which frame it.

Item.Name: daisys basket flower
Item.LongDescription: There is a basket of daisys here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A simple rattaned basket holds an explosion of cheerful white daisys.

Item.Name: Irises flower
Item.LongDescription: Many long stalks of bright blue flowers lie here.

ExtraDescription.Description: These freshly gathered irises still bear traces of morning dew, and their bright blue flowers and sword-like leaves greet you cordially.

Item.Name: Nosegay rosebuds flower
Item.LongDescription: There is a bunch of pink, unopened roses here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A lovingly tied bouquet of pink roses in early bloom is here, held together with a red velvet bow.

Item.Name: Violets box flower
Item.LongDescription: A sprig of purple violets lies sleepily in a box here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A strange wooden box here holds several stemless purple violets.

Item.Name: Poppy poppies vase flower
Item.LongDescription: A make shift vase which holds a number of delicate, white flowers is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A vase fashioned from part of a tree trunk holds several sprays of small, scented, white, cup-like flowers here.

Item.Name: Sunflower bouquet flower
Item.LongDescription: A huge bouquet of bright orange and yellow flowers is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: Your heart instantly lifts at the bursts of vivid colour from the fiery red-orange centres of the flowers.

Item.Name: dress
Item.LongDescription: A floral dress lies here, waiting to look pretty on somebody.

ExtraDescription.Description: It's a flouncy and frilly thing, the color of crushed lavender.

Item.Name: sonnet
Item.LongDescription: A badly-written love sonnet lies here unrequited, full of emotion.

ExtraDescription.Description: It's one of the Bard's... "O me! What eyes hath Love put in my head, Which have no correspondence with true sight; Or, if they have, where is my judgement fled, That censures falsely what they see aright? If that be fair whereon my false eyes dote, What means the world to say it is not so? If it be not, then love doth well denote Love's eye is not so true as all men's: no. How can it? O! How can Love's eye be true, That is so vex'd with watching and with tears? No marvel then, though I mistake my view; The sun itself sees not till heaven clears. O cunning love! With tears thou keep'st me blind, Lest eyes well-seeing thy foul faults should find." You feel like throwing it away.

Item.Name: four-leaf clover
Item.LongDescription: A Four-Leaf Clover.

ExtraDescription.Description: Some like to think this rather ordinary-looking leaf a symbol of innocent love. Bah.

Item.Name: Sword
Item.LongDescription: There is a shiny steel sword with a decorated hilt here.

ExtraDescription.Description: The sword you hold in your hands once belonged to a templar knight of great renown and virtue as can be seen from the intricate carvings on the hilt of the blade. The crown, dove and cross signify great deeds of virtue done in honour of King, God and Church.

Item.Name: Cross
Item.LongDescription: A small wooden cross lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This small and nicely carved wooden cross has a long chain of black leather string attached to it so that it may be worn around the neck. Carved probably by one of the monks of old, you wonder whether you should wear it. Is it a worthless trinket, or a symbol of great importance ?

Item.Name: surcoat
Item.LongDescription: A white surcoat with an emblazoned red cross lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This is a white surcoat with a red cross in the front and back of it. Worn by the crusader knights of the barbarian lands, it has seen better days. However, the tough and fine material it was made of has allowed it to stand the rigors of battle and travel.

Item.Name: shirt mailed
Item.LongDescription: A shirt of tough steel mail is lying here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This shirt of steel mail is the standard armour of the Crusader Knights. Made for practical protection rather than fanfare or tourneys, it looks battered in a few places and has lost it's original luster. It can still be used though, and is much lighter than full plate mail.

Item.Name: steel leggings
Item.ShortDescription: a pair of light steel leggings
Item.LongDescription: A pair of firm looking steel leg armour lies on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: This is a sturdy though battered pair of leggings worn by the Crusader Knights. The closely meshed steel make it somewhat less protective than full steel plates, but is more comfortable and awards the wearer with greater movement and dexterity. Although it's been through much use, it's obvious that great care has been taken to keep it clean, shiny and whole.

Item.Name: sollerets boots
Item.LongDescription: A pair of strong steel boots rests here.

ExtraDescription.Description: Made for maximum protection with minimum weight, the soft fur inner lining of the boots make it both comfortable and safe. The soles have been fitted with rubber and leather, reducing the clanking when walking.

The dim torchlight of the clearing casts twisted shadows on the Altar of Sacrifice. It almost seems as if dwarfed shades are dancing across its surface. Runnels of dried blood stain the altar to its centre, which has been staved in with the imprint of a monstrous cloven hoof.

Item.Name: heart
Item.LongDescription: The heart of a nymph pumps horribly on the floor.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is a gruesome thing, torn from the body of a living nymph. Evil- magic has kept it pulsing, and it continues to bleed painfully.

Item.Name: chest
Item.LongDescription: There is a sturdy wooden chest at the foot of the bed.

Item.Name: herbal potion
Item.LongDescription: A potion marked "Ranger Aid".

ExtraDescription.Description: The potion is marked "Ranger Aid" and seems to have been brewed from a colorful variety of forest herbs.

Item.Name: mushroom
Item.LongDescription: A small blue-capped mushroom lies uprooted, resting on its side.

ExtraDescription.Description: A small blue-capped mushroom lies uprooted, resting on its side.

Item.Name: Yew bow
Item.LongDescription: An elegant yew bow lies here amongst the rocks.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is a long and supple weapon worked from yew by elven craft and magic. It is surrounded by an aura of goodness.

Item.Name: sandstone altar
Item.LongDescription: An ancient sandstone altar sits here, weathering all time.

ExtraDescription.Description: An ancient sandstone altar sits here, weathering all time.
You see miniature furniture inside the bole of this tree. This could very well be the home of a fairy, or a house-proud squirrel.

Item.Name: nut nuts cache
Item.LongDescription: A cache of nuts lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: These delicious-looking nuts must be from a squirrel's winter larder.

Item.Name: Herman Melville book
Item.LongDescription: Herman Melville's "Moby Dick" lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A classic tale of man against fish. Flipping through it, you notice that the word "eskimo" has been circled repeatedly in red.

Item.Name: shield melancholic
Item.LongDescription: A green and silver shield bears a bleeding heart device.

ExtraDescription.Description: This is a Knight Melancholic's shield, and it bears the crest of the Order, that of a bleeding heart skewered by a sword and crossed with roses. You feel at once angry with and tired of life just looking at the device.

Item.Name: sword swiftbird
Item.LongDescription: A sword called "Swiftbird" sings a melancholic lament.

ExtraDescription.Description: This sword has been beautifully crafted, meant to bring woe measure for measure to the enemies of its wielder. Engraved along the blade of the weapon is the device of the Order of the Knights Melancholic and the words, "Honor, Love, Pain, Death and Poetry".

Item.Name: marmalade Orb
Item.LongDescription: A striped marmalade orb floats in the air near you.

ExtraDescription.Description: The orb is fist-sized and pulsates with an otherworldly energy. As you examine it closer, it spits a burst of magic into the air. It emits a low hum that sounds almost like the purring of a cat.

Item.Name: TianCanShenGong Manual
Item.LongDescription: An ancient transcript with oriental scriblings radiates brightly here.

ExtraDescription.Description: Browsing through the manual, you notice the following oriental words that glows right out of the page : Bu Pa Tian Cang Di Jui Zi Pa Cheng Jing Yong You

Item.Name: bible
Item.LongDescription: A small black bible lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This small black bible looks well thumbed and has a weathered binding. One of the bibles used by chapel-goers of the past, it seems to have survived time, dust and wind. A small name seems to have been written neatly on the top right hand corner of the first page, you can just make out 'Sebastian' on it.

Item.Name: map
Item.LongDescription: A paw-written dirty-old map lies on the floor.

Item.Name: marcel proust mace book
Item.ShortDescription: Marcel Proust's "A la Recherche du Temps Perdu"
Item.LongDescription: Marcel Proust's "A la Recherche du Temps Perdu" lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: All 7 related books of this literary masterpiece have been bound in one weighty collection. It looks extremely valuable.

Item.Name: dagger stick sword-stick
Item.LongDescription: A sword-stick lies on the grass here.

ExtraDescription.Description: The sword-stick seems to have been cunningly fashioned from the branch of a tree. It is about 2 feet long and has edges as sharp as that of any steel sword. Its pommel has been carved into the likeness of a demon elf with a mysterious expression on her face.

Item.Name: bookcase cabinet
Item.LongDescription: An ornate mahogany book cabinet sits in the corner of the room.

ExtraDescription.Description: Peering inside, you see that the book cabinet has been furnished with a complete set of the Bard's plays, lots of Tolkien and C. S. Lewis, a set of Edgar Allan Poe's short stories, and other famed works of literature, like "Faust", "To The Lighthouse", "Les Fleurs du mal", Tama Janowitz's "The Male Cross-Dresser's Support Group", and an autographed collection of Steve Nicks lyrics.

Item.Name: bow ashen longbow
Item.LongDescription: A skillfully crafted longbow with a quiver of arrows lie here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This longbow is six feet tall and made from the sturdy, supple wood of the valley ash. Clearly, it has been crafted by skillful hands.

Item.Name: hell-spear spear
Item.LongDescription: A Hell-Spear wreathed in black flames.
Item.ExtraFlags: Dark Magic NoDrop AntiGood Frost Sharp TwoHands Poison Unholy

ExtraDescription.Description: Five and half feet of night-black iron, the Hell-Spears were forged in the Devil's infernal smithies for his huntsmen to claim the souls of the damned. Serpentine tendrils of smoke curl down along its shaft.

Item.Name: tulips bunch flower
Item.LongDescription: There is a bunch of yellow tulips here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A few choice stalks of yellow tulips are here, wrapped carefully in brown paper.

Item.Name: gourd
Item.LongDescription: A hollowed husk of a fruit lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A hollowed husk of a fruit lies here.

Item.Name: wafers wafer
Item.LongDescription: A creamy thin piece of biscuit lies here tempting you.

ExtraDescription.Description: Can you resist me?

Item.Name: sack
Item.LongDescription: A brownish leather-like sack rests here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A brownish leather-like sack rests here.

Item.Name: Brinjal gourd
Item.LongDescription: Some purplish husk of a fruit lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: Some purplish husk of a fruit lies here.

Item.Name: Omelette surprise plate
Item.LongDescription: A plate of beaten eggs, deliciously fried rests here.

ExtraDescription.Description: An Omelette Surprise! ! !

Item.Name: milkshake vanilla
Item.LongDescription: A creamy-white glass of milkshake lies untouched here.

Item.Name: pancakes plate
Item.LongDescription: A plate of golden pancakes, smothered in maple syrup tempts you.

ExtraDescription.Description: A stack of pancakes winks at you seductively.

Item.Name: dish pate saucer
Item.LongDescription: A brown glob in a wide saucer lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: Farmer Griff's slaughtered Goose, Duffie's liver!

Item.Name: duck
Item.LongDescription: A whole roast duck is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: Farmer Griff's Speciality -- A golden roasted duck with a savory aroma, fresh from the oven.

Item.Name: stew bowl
Item.LongDescription: A mystical bowl with strange engravings lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This mystical brew blends 21 herbs from the depths of Emerald Forest, carefully broiled with a pig's brain. A fragrant aroma of sea cucumber adds a delicate flavour to this savory dish.

Item.Name: bun
Item.LongDescription: A white doughed dumpling with a little red dot is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: Still warm from the oven rack, this fist-sized white bun is wrapped with roast pork.

Item.Name: book
Item.LongDescription: An oil-soiled book is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: As you glance through this precious book of farmer Griff's, your eyes are irresitably drawn to this page... Coeur de licorne This special dish, when consumed on the Day of Thunder, 3rd Month of Nature in Heaven's Grotto, releases the power of immortality to its consumer. A) half a pound heart of Unicorn b) 3 ounces of blue-capped mushroom pounded into fine dust. C) a teasepoon of sun-flower pollen d) 2 clover sprigs e) a heart of a Nymph f) a whisker of a marmalade cat g) a cup of spring water Instructions overleaf.

Item.Name: apron
Item.LongDescription: A blue, embroided apron lies folded on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: A fanciful "G" is nicely embroided in the apron's centre.

Item.Name: key iron
Item.LongDescription: A key lies here tarnished in rust.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is covered with rust.

Item.Name: skin cloak
Item.ShortDescription: the skin of an elven princess
Item.LongDescription: A wide cloak made from the skin of an elven princess.

ExtraDescription.Description: An elven princess of a past age gave up her skin to the witches of the Lochhearn to save her people, and they made this awful artifact from her sacrifice. The coven at Struith is now destroyed, but this example of their evil and blasphemy has been saved by the Last Sisters. It retains a flawless and immortal beauty that is horrible to behold.

Item.Name: candle
Item.LongDescription: A blood candle paints the room red.

ExtraDescription.Description: The blood candle burns so that only you can see its light. It is made by witches from the blood and fat of dead women and can be extinguished only by dousing its dark flame with milk.

Item.Name: ring scarab beetle
Item.LongDescription: A petrified beetle dipped in gold has been dead a long time.

ExtraDescription.Description: A large ugly beetle has been dipped in liquid gold. Its legs curl in the manner of death and you imagine you could slip the thing over your finger if you wanted to.

Item.Name: wig
Item.LongDescription: A green serpent-tressed wig slithers about on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: Your vision swims even as you look at the wig, a mass of small green serpents sewn into what looks like human skin. The serpents suddenly stop writhing and you find yourself staring at a dirty wig dyed with crushed moss and leaves.

Item.Name: circlet
Item.LongDescription: A blackened circlet with a stone of dull white fire.

ExtraDescription.Description: In a thick band of cracked black leather has been set a stone which glows dully from within a circle of crystal. It radiates an aura of evil, and merely being in its presence fills you with a sense of dread and fear.

Item.Name: gown samite
Item.ShortDescription: a beautiful gown of white samite
Item.LongDescription: A white samite gown lies here like a symbol of beauty and purity.

ExtraDescription.Description: The gown of white samite flows long and smoothly to the ground. It is trimmed with ermine and has been embroidered with silken runes. You hesitate at the thought of sullying it with your hands and wonder at the blood that may have been shed by those seeking to possess it or the one clothed in it.

Item.Name: whip tail manticore
Item.ShortDescription: the whipping tail of a manticore
Item.LongDescription: A chitinous chain of black plates with a whipping end.

ExtraDescription.Description: This exotic instrument of death is the massive tail of a manticore. The severed end has been cauterized and bound with magic to a greaved haft of black iron.

Item.Name: dagger Yog-Sothoth
Item.LongDescription: A blue steel dagger with a blackened hilt lies here.
Item.ExtraFlags: Glow Magic Flaming Frost Vorpal TwoHands

ExtraDescription.Description: The name of the god Yog-Sothoth has been runed upon the blade of this dagger. Its steel mirrors your reflection in waves that decay and rot your image. An ancient fear claws at your soul as you look upon it.

Item.Name: root three-eyed
Item.LongDescription: A three-eyed root stares right at you!

ExtraDescription.Description: These roots grow in the deepest marshes, feeding off the remains of dead animals and men. Its body is a dirty mauve and bears three red eyes which seem to be staring at you.

Item.Name: root
Item.LongDescription: A three-eyed root stares right at you!

ExtraDescription.Description: These roots grow in the deepest marshes, feeding off the remains of dead animals and men. Its body is a dirty mauve and bears three red eyes which seem to be staring at you.

Item.Name: Hell-blade blade
Item.LongDescription: A Hell-Blade wreathed in black flames.
Item.ExtraFlags: Dark Magic NoDrop AntiGood Frost Sharp TwoHands Poison Unholy

ExtraDescription.Description: Names of damned souls like so many pits and scratches have been burned into the blade of this evil sword. Black flames run along its blade near your hand and serpentine tendrils of smoke twist around your fingers. A name glows for a moment and it seems to be your own.

Item.Name: Word
Item.LongDescription: A word lies here on the floor.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is written in a foreign tongue. You can't understand it.

Item.Name: carnations carnation flower
Item.LongDescription: Several long-stemmed carnations are here.

ExtraDescription.Description: These white carnations, flushed with pink tinges, give off a strong sweet fragrance.

Item.Name: casket dandelion dandelions flower
Item.LongDescription: A handful of wispy white flowers floats wispfully in the air in front of you.

ExtraDescription.Description: These tiny, feathery white balls are said to contain the souls of youngling faeries, who assume form at certain hours of the night as they dance gaily in homage to Flora. They lie here now, fluffly and quiet, in their wooden casket.

Item.Name: carrion flower
Item.LongDescription: A grotesque scaley plant sits here on the floor, covered in a fog of flies.

ExtraDescription.Description: A sick stench blindsides you and leaves you momentarily senseless. As you wave numbly at the dense mass of flies that surround it, you see a bulbous spiney star-shapped plant with yellow markings. Amidst the smell its emanates, which conjures up images of rank damp rotting bodies, it looks as though - could it be - the Carrion Flower grins evily at you, revelling the countless lifes it has already claimed.

Item.Name: tub crocuses
Item.ShortDescription: a tub of bright yellow crocuses
Item.LongDescription: A stubby stone tub here holds several bright yellow flower bulbs.

ExtraDescription.Description: A queer cracked stone with beautiful cravings on the side holds serveral yellow and orange cup-like bloom.

Item.Name: cactus
Item.LongDescription: A solitary spiked cactus is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This desert shrub seems somewhat out of place but its proud, throny spine and tiny white blossoms make it the ideal house warming gift.

Item.Name: lancelot signet ring
Item.LongDescription: An ancient signet ring lies here tarnished and forgotten.

ExtraDescription.Description: This ring looks like a thing from another and much older age. Its band of white-gold is very tarnished and dull. You can just make out upon the signet's face the faded impression of a white stallion's proud head. Around its perimeter has been engraved in Latin the chivalric motto of the Knights of the Table Round and the name of Lancelot, the fallen Knight of Avalon.

The scrying pool lies still and murky. The witches seem to have tossed bones, old jewellery and odd trinkets in here where they now lie decaying or corroded. You notice something glimmer faintly at the bottom of the pool.

Item.Name: staff
Item.LongDescription: The Grand Pooh-Ba's staff is covered with twirlers and confetti.

ExtraDescription.Description: This is the Grand Pooh-Ba's ceremonial staff. In his officiation over the Brownie-Pixie Bonanzas, this hoary willow staff is used both to conjure up simple fare and beverage, and to thump over- enthusiastic party-goers over the head.

Item.Name: pool water
Item.LongDescription: A rock pool with crystal clear water has formed.

ExtraDescription.Description: A rock pool with crystal clear water has formed.

Item.Name: knapsack sack
Item.LongDescription: A knapsack made from the finest leather rests here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A knapsack made from the finest leather rests here.

Item.Name: well water
Item.LongDescription: An old cracked well stands rooted in the center of the village square.

ExtraDescription.Description: An old cracked well stands rooted in the center of the village square.

Item.Name: bone bracelet
Item.LongDescription: A bracelet strung from pieces of bones lies uninvitingly here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This ornamental chain was strung from blackened knuckle bones of an elf. It is surrounded with an aura of death.

Item.Name: elven kind boots
Item.LongDescription: A pair of boots of elven kind is here.
